intro: Psychotria calva, commonly known as the "Ghost Plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria calva is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecological interactions of its habitat.
